intro: Agati coccinea, commonly known as the red agate tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it produces small, woody fruits containing several seeds. Agati coccinea is often found in dry forest and scrub habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique floral display makes it a notable species in its native ecosystem.
